definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of

sentences.english: Then Master Linton has forgot the first injunction of his uncle,' I observed: `he bid us keep on the Grange land, and here we are off at once.'
sentences.chinese: 那麼林惇少爺已經忘了他舅舅的第一道禁令了。
林惇從大門口那兒喊着。

sentences.english: Mr Linton of Thrushcross Grange,' she replied.
sentences.chinese: “畫眉田莊的林惇先生，”她回答。

sentences.english: It was yourself, Mrs Linton: you knew it a while since.
sentences.chinese: 那是你自己，林惇夫人，你剛纔還知道的。

sentences.english: The moment Catherine left Mr Linton's room, she appeared at my bedside.
sentences.chinese: 凱瑟琳一離開林惇先生的屋子，就出現在我的牀邊。

sentences.english: Are you truly stronger, Linton, than when we separated in winter?
sentences.chinese: 林惇，你是真的比我們在冬天分手時強壯些嗎？

sentences.english: But Linton and I have no share in your quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 可是林惇和我並沒有參加你們的爭吵啊。

sentences.english: She even disgraces the name of Linton.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至都玷辱了林惇的名聲。

sentences.english: While they exchanged caresses, I took a peep in to see after Linton.
sentences.chinese: 在他們互相擁抱的時候，我偷看了林惇一下。

sentences.english: Black hair and eyes!' mused Linton.
You wouldn't injure me, Linton, would you?
sentences.chinese: 你不會傷害我的，林惇，你會嗎？

sentences.english: And would Mr Linton approve of his sister marrying that man?' I inquired.
sentences.chinese: “而且林惇先生會同意他妹妹嫁給那個人嗎？”我問。

sentences.english: The gardeners and coachman were there; but Linton was with them.
sentences.chinese: 園丁和馬伕是在那兒，可是林惇也跟他們在一起。

sentences.english: Linton slowly trailed himself off, and lay down.
sentences.chinese: 林惇慢慢地拖着腳步走過去，躺下來。

sentences.english: And would Mr Linton approve of his sister marrying that man?
sentences.chinese: 而且林惇先生會同意他妹妹嫁給那個人嗎？

definition: to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
